column4: hello, i have had instability issues with ubuntu for a long time, my hardware is just crappy... i have a problem now, i've re-installed windows to the harddrive, but, it doesnt re-write the boot loader... i've looked at the hdd, its one partition, all ntfs...
how do i get rid of grub and have it work properly to boot my winxp install?
can you boot windows xp alright?
you can boot the winxp cd in rescue mode and do a "fdisk /mbr" to wipe out grub and fix the master boot record.
